meanings.definition: A material similar to paper made from the pith of the papyrus plant.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians used papyri to write important documents.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient papyri with intricate hieroglyphics.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten batted at the delicate papyri, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like the ink on the papyri, weaving a tale of love.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the papyri reminded him of the fleeting nature of life.

meanings.definition: Plural form of papyrus, referring to ancient manuscripts written on papyrus.
meanings.sent1: Scholars study the papyri to learn about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: The library houses a collection of valuable papyri from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist's dog dug up a bundle of ancient papyri in the desert.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a treasure trove of papyri, each holding secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The papyri whispered stories of bygone times to those who dared to read them.
